articles.title: Congratulations to Chad Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Chad Prime Minister

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Emmanuel Djelassern Nadingar upon his reappointment as prime minister of Chad.
					
					The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger day by day and wished him greater success in his work for national unity and the economic development of the country. 
					
					Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Moussa Faki Mahamat upon his reappointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and African Integration on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations to Nepali Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Nepali Prime Minister

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a congratulatory message to Baburam Bhattarai upon his election as prime minister of Nepal on August 30.
					
					The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations with the long history and tradition between the two countries would continue to develop, wishing him success in his work for the country's political stability, peace and economic prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Vietnamese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese President

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Truong Tan Sang, president of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, on the occasion of its 66th birthday.
					
					Kim in the message noted that the Vietnamese people are achieving success in their struggle for building a rich and powerful state under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					
					Expressing belief that the long-standing and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in the common interests and desire of the two peoples, the message wished the Socialist Republic of Vietnam prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Greets His Vietnamese Counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Greets His Vietnamese Counterpart

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, Thursday on the occasion of its 66th birthday.
					
					The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields, wishing the prime minister of Vietnam greater success in his work for prosperity and development of the country.
					
					DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Vietnamese counterpart Pham Binh Minh on the same day.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Uzbekistan

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					
					Kim in the message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.

articles.title: Greetings to FM of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Greetings to FM of Uzbekistan

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Thursday sent a message of greeting to E. M. Ganiev, foreign minister of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					
					The message wished the foreign minister of Uzbekistan success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Slovakia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Slovakia

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Ivan Gasparovic, president of Slovakia, on the occasion of its Constitutional Day.
					
					Kim in the message wished Slovakia new development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Slovak PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Slovak PM

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Iveta Radicova, prime minister of Slovakia, on the occasion of its Constitutional Day.
					
					The message wished the prime minister success in her work for the development of the country and well-being of the people.
					
					DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Slovak counterpart Mikulas Dzurinda on the same day.

articles.title: Greetings to Cuban Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Cuban Foreign Minister

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla, foreign minister of Cuba, on Aug. 29 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Cuba.
					
					The message expressed the wholehearted support and solidarity with the struggle of the Cuban government and people.

articles.title: Foreign Guests and Overseas Compatriots Pay Tribute to President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Guests and Overseas Compatriots Pay Tribute to President Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Among them were the delegation of Kyodo News and its affiliated agencies headed by Satoshi Ishikawa, president of Kyodo News, and the delegation of officials of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan headed by Ryang Ok Chul, vice-chairwoman of its Central Standing Committee.
					
					They paid homage in boundless reverence to the President.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Mangyongdae School Children's Palace
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Mangyongdae School Children's Palace

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of embassies of different countries here visited the Mangyongdae School Children's Palace Thursday on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					Being briefed on the fact that the palace was successfully built as a center for school children after school education under the warm loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the guests looked round various hobby group rooms there.
					
					Then, they enjoyed a performance given by members of the art group of the palace.

articles.title: Rason-Mt. Kumgang Demonstration International Tourist Group Arrives
articles.content:
Rason-Mt. Kumgang Demonstration International Tourist Group Arrives

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Rason-Mt. Kumgang demonstration international tourist group headed by Kim Song Mun, director of the Tourism Administration of the Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture of China, arrived at a wharf of Kosong Port by ship "Mangyongbong" on Wednesday.
					
					The DPRK Guidance Bureau of Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang gave a reception for the tourist group this day.

articles.title: Rason-Mt. Kumgang Demonstration International Tourist Group Tours Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
Rason-Mt. Kumgang Demonstration International Tourist Group Tours Mt. Kumgang

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Rason-Mt. Kumgang demonstration international tourist group headed by Kim Song Mun, director of the Tourism Administration of the Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture of China, toured Mt. Kumgang, a famous mountain of Korea, on Wednesday and Thursday.
					
					The guests went round Kuryong Falls, Lagoon Samil, Sea Kumgang area to be admired at the miraculousness and beauty.
					
					They also appreciated a performance of the Pyongyang Moranbong Circus.
					
					During its stay a briefing on investment to the special zone for international tour of Mt. Kumgang took place.
					
					The tourist group went back by the ship "Mangyongbong" on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Japanese Delegation

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of Kyodo News and its affiliated agencies headed by Satoshi Ishikawa, president of Kyodo News, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Reception Given to Mark 5th Anniversary of Opening of Pyongyang Office of Kyodo News
articles.content:
Reception Given to Mark 5th Anniversary of Opening of Pyongyang Office of Kyodo News

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Kyodo News of Japan hosted a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Thursday to mark the 5th anniversary of its Pyongyang Office.
					
					Present there on invitation were Director General Kim Pyong Ho and other officials of the KCNA and officials concerned.
					
					On hand were the members of the delegation of Kyodo News and its affiliated agencies headed by Satoshi Ishikawa, president of Kyodo News, on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassy by Bangladeshi Personages
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassy by Bangladeshi Personages

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi figures paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Dhaka on August 25 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					
					Among them were Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, and Ragib Ahsan Munna, secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee.
					
					They laid a floral basket before a full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					They wished the Korean people greater success in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK public health led by Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, to visit China and participate in a meeting of health ministers of the Northeast Asian regional countries of the WHO and its regional meeting to be held in India and a friendship visiting group of the Ministry of Public Security led by its Chief of Staff Kim Chol Ung to visit China left here today by air.
					
					Han Chun Hui, widow of Choe Hong Hui, former president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, and her party arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Performance Given by Successful Entrants into Art Contest among UAWK Organizations
articles.content:
Performance Given by Successful Organizations into Art Contest among UAWK Organizations

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by successful organizations into a national art contest among organizations of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) at the Central Hall of Workers Thursday to mark the 63rd birthday of the DPRK.
					
					Put on the stage were colorful numbers prepared by art squad members of the UAW in rural villages in South Hwanghae, South and North Phyongan and South Hamgyong provinces.
					
					The performers sang high praises of President Kim Il Sung who built the people's country on this land and laid an eternal foundation for its prosperity and the undying revolutionary exploits leader Kim Jong Il has performed by demonstrating the dignity and might of the DPRK before the whole world.
					
					Mixed duet "We Are Kind-hearted Couple on the Farm", vocal trio and story-telling "Land and Farmer" and poem recital and story-telling "Let's Defend Our Land" vividly showcased the life of agricultural workers.
					
					Among the audience were Ri Yong Su, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and agricultural workers here.

articles.title: Kumgang, Scenic Mountain of Korea
articles.content:
Kumgang, Scenic Mountain of Korea

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Rason-Mt. Kumgang tourism by sea is now going on in the DPRK.
					
					Mt. Kumgang is known as one of the world's famous mountains.
					
					Skyscraping peaks, rocks of myriad shapes, fantastic cliffs, deep valleys, many pools and ponds, crystal-like water, many waterfalls, various species of animals and plants and thick foliage -- these are the main features of the mountain.
					
					From ancient times, the mountain has had different names like Mt. Pongrae, Mt. Phungak and Mt. Kaegol.
					
					Kumgang means the mountain's scenery in spring, Pongrae in summer, Phungak in autumn and Kaegol in winter.

articles.title: Constellation-Inscribed Dolmens
articles.content:
Constellation-Inscribed Dolmens

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Dolmen inscribed with constellation is one of the relics indicative of the development of astronomy in ancient Korea.
					
					Some 200 dolmens of such kind have been discovered in the country. Most of them were found in Pyongyang, which was the capital of ancient Korea. 
					
					More than 40 constellations of different sizes, including the Great Bear, are seen on the surface of dolmens' cover stones. 
					
					About 70 dolmens with constellations on cover stones, dating back to the period of King Tangun, were discovered in Jongdong-ri, Unchon County, South Hwanghae Province. Of them four has the Great Bear and 30 have 28 constellations with holes connected with each other.
					
					It is hard to find in other countries such many constellations inscribed properly in accordance with their brightness and size in ancient time.
					
					The dolmens indicate that the Taedong River basin was a birthplace of the ancient astronomy.

articles.title: Decorative Patterns of Korea
articles.content:
Decorative Patterns of Korea

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- From ancient times the Korean people have applied different decorative patterns to handiworks, cloth, daily necessities and buildings.
					
					Decorative patterns in Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C.-668 A.D.) were characterized by powerful, elastic and formative styles.
					
					Those in Koryo (early 10th century-late 14th century) were represented by such plants as wild amomile, peony, willow and prunus mume, as well as water bird, fish and insects.
					
					Letter patterns were popular in the period of Ri Dynasty.
					
					The present-day patterns are embellished with flowers like magnolia, azalea, lily of the valley and white apricot blossom.

articles.title: National Angling Contest Held
articles.content:
National Angling Contest Held

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The 10th national contest among angling fans was held on the bank of the River Taedong Thursday.
					
					It brought together officials and members of angling fans association from across the country, more than 120 in all.
					
					Those selected in provinces and national institutions used angling gears and baits prepared by themselves.
					
					The standings were set according to the number and size of fishes caught during the given time.
					
					An angling gear exhibition was also held on the same day. Put on display were 338 pieces of 114 kinds of angling tools and baits including automatic signal devices and universal bolsters.
					
					Visual aids related to the angling were also displayed.

articles.title: Papers Call for Holding Higher Banner of Independence against Imperialism
articles.content:
Papers Call for Holding Higher Banner of Independence against Imperialism

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Today marks the day of the Non-aligned Movement (NAM) and the 50th anniversary of its foundation.
					
					Leading papers here devote signed articles to this day.
					
					They say that the NAM has made a great contribution to the struggle for defending world peace and security, achieving the independence of the countries and nations and building a just and peaceful new world over the past 50 years under the uplifted banner of the NAM and the banner of independence against imperialism.
					
					The NAM has developed into the most powerful independent forces against imperialism in the present era as it speaks for and defends the interests of the non-aligned and other developing countries and dynamically pushes forward global independence, Rodong Sinmun notes, and goes on:
					
					President Kim Il Sung comprehensively and lucidly clarified all the theoretical and practical issues arising in defending the fundamental idea of the NAM and its purity, raising its position and role and augmenting the might of the movement on various occasions.
					
					The President encouraged the non-aligned countries in boosting the NAM and accelerating its advance with a clear objective and faith.
					
					There are no such organized forces in our times as the NAM which groups so many countries of the world and wages struggles, taking independence against imperialism as the noble idea of its activities.
					
					As long as the imperialist and hegemonic forces pursue domination, interference, aggression and plunder in the world, the NAM should remain true to its fundamental idea and continue to intensify the struggle for independence against imperialism.
					
					An intensified struggle for independence against imperialism only would make it possible to defend the world peace and security and independent rights and interests of the people, consolidate national independence and achieve social progress.
					
					Independence against imperialism is the banner which the NAM should hold high in its struggle.
					
					Minju Joson notes the most urgent duty facing the NAM at present is to prevent the danger of war and defend the peace and security of the world.

articles.title: Jilin Province, China Marked with Inerasable Traces of DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
Jilin Province, China Marked with Inerasable Traces of DPRK-China Friendship

					Beijing, August 31 (KCNA) -- Jilin Province, one of the three provinces in Northeast China, is the historic land which President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il visited several times, bringing the flower garden of the DPRK-China friendship into full bloom. 
					
					Changchun City of Jilin Province, in particular, is a city of friendship which the peoples of the two countries always remember. The President visited Northeast China in September of 1964 and met with Premier Zhou Enlai. Kim Jong Il cordially met and had talks with General Secretary Hu Jintao in August of last year. It was revisited by Kim Jong Il again in May this year.
					
					He visited Jilin Province again on August 27 on his way home after wrapping up his visit to Russia.
					
					There are many time-honored revolutionary battle sites and historic sites including Jilin associated with the brilliant history of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle of Kim Il Sung in the area of Jilin Province.
					
					The province has made rapid progress in various fields thanks to the great attention of the Communist Party of China and the devoted struggle of the people there.
					
					It tops the nation's list of producers in varieties of products in equipment, automobiles, and chemical fiber.
					
					Recent years witnessed the construction of express highways in various sections. Their total length increased to 1 850 kilometers.
					
					The railway project for trains running at the speed of 250km per hour was completed to link Changchun with Jilin and opened to traffic in January of this year. This is the first high-speed one in Northeast China.
					
					A work is now under way to reconstruct the already existing areas under irrigation, improve waterways and introduce the technology of saving water for irrigation.
					
					Ecological circumstance has been improved as a result of afforestation.
					
					Forests covering 116 000 ha have been created over the last decade.
					
					Whenever Kim Jong Il visited Jilin Province, he highly appreciated the signal successes made by the province under the leadership of the CPC and wished it new success in the struggle for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of its people.
					
					The people in the province are turning out as one in the struggle to carry out the long-term goal during the 12th five year plan.
					
					The province will take on a new appearance on the road of advance for the socialist modernization drive with Chinese characteristics and convey the tradition of the historic DPRK-China friendship to posterity.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms Japan's Moves to Revise Constitution Dangerous
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms Japan's Moves to Revise Constitution Dangerous

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, a Japanese high-ranking conservative politician at the place where the Ground "Self-Defense Force" is stationed in Hokkaido let loose a spate of reckless remarks that "there is not yet any environment where the SDF can act within the framework legitimately stipulated by the Constitution" and "it is necessary to create at the earliest possible date such environment through cooperation among politicians, regardless of ruling or opposition parties."
					
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This indicates that the moves to revise the existing Constitution in Japan for the purpose of developing the SDF into "a legitimate army" and using it as a military tool for realizing its ambition for overseas aggression have gained in an undisguised new dimension.
					
					The existing Constitution which Japan has so far advocated as a "symbol of pacifist state" bans the possession of any regular forces and military capability forces and participation in any war. The Japanese militarists now regard it as an extremely troublesome and cumbersome thing as they seek to turn Japan into a military power and realize their ambition for reinvasion.
					
					That is why they are making a desperate effort to rewrite the Constitution overtly and covertly. Their ultimate goal is to make the "pacifist Constitution" a war Constitution. Japan's purpose is to turn the SDF into a regular army and put the establishment of a wartime mobilization system and start of a war on a legal and political basis.
					
					In a word, the Japanese reactionaries are set to pave the way for reinvasion and realize their militarist ambition in a legitimate manner by adopting the above-said war constitution.
					
					Herein lies the criminal and dangerous nature of the moves to revise the Constitution.
					
					Japan is contemplating further modernizing its militarist forces in a bid to round off its preparations for overseas aggression and go into action any moment. The first target of this scenario is the DPRK.
					
					A spate of reckless remarks calling for the dispatch of the SDF in "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula are let loose and the attempt to grab Tok Islets are openly disclosed by the Japanese reactionary ruling forces. This eloquently proves that their reinvasion of Korea is becoming a reality.

articles.title: Prison Term Imposed on Ex-chairman of Namchongryon in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prison Term Imposed on Ex-chairman of Namchongryon in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Kwangju District Court on August 30 sentenced to three years in jail, four years of stay of execution and three years of suspension of qualification the ex-chairman of the Kwangju-South Jolla Provincial Federation of University Student Councils (Namchongryon) under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law", the south Korean Yonhap News said.
					
					The puppet court took such action against him for the mere reason that he acted as deputy to Hanchongryon and chairman of Namchongryon, which it labeled "enemy-benefiting organizations," and "manufactured and distributed literature benefiting the enemy and participated in illegal demonstrations" in 2007 and 2008.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Human Rights Abuses

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Joint Action for Meeting with Prisoners of Conscience held a press conference outside Seoul Prison on August 29 denouncing the puppet authorities for their abuses of rights of prisoners of conscience.
					
					At the press conference the organization recalled that many people who turned out in the struggle for independence, democracy, reunification and vital rights are detained in the prison on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law".
					
					The authorities are undisguisedly abusing human rights such as keeping a pro-reunification activist charged with the involvement in the conspiratorial "spy ring case" in custody at a place where cameras are monitoring every movement of the activist, it charged.
					
					Even meeting with the prisoners of conscience is disallowed, it said, urging the authorities to stop the suppression of democracy and human rights under the pretext of security and set free the prisoners of conscience at an early date.

articles.title: Military Base Construction Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Military Base Construction Protested in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Professors on Jeju Province of south Korea held a press conference at the Jeju Provincial Assembly on August 30 and demanded the puppet authorities stop the construction of the naval base.
					
					They accused the authorities of hurling police force into Jeju Island and detaining several persons including the chairman of the Kangjong Village Association.
					
					Such suppression will spark off serious confrontation and conflict only, they warned.
					
					They urged the authorities to set free all the detainees, stop the project and get the police force withdrawn from there.

articles.title: Struggle against Traitorous Regime Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Traitorous Regime Unabated in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Mass struggle of people of all social standings of south Korea are unabated as they are determined to put an end to the present puppet authorities' traitorous rule.
					
					The spirit of anti-"government" struggle is running high against the authorities which pushed the north-south relations to the lowest ebb, in pursuance of the hostile policy toward the DPRK with August 15 as an occasion.
					
					Civic and public organizations and political parties held the August 15 meeting for independence and reunification in Seoul on August 15. They said that they can never remain an on-looker to the present authorities which persists in the hostile policy toward the fellow countrymen, while going against the nation's desire for reunification.
					
					The farmers across south Korea held a meeting for independence and reunification on August 15 outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul at which they declared that they would launch an action to judge the group of traitors.
					
					The large-scale Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises that were staged from August 16 to 26 touched off the indignation of the south Koreans.
					
					Peace movement organizations held the 143rd action for independence, reunification and peace on August 16, denouncing the warmongers' racket for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					Such civic and public organizations as the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued statements and appeals at the same time, calling on all the Koreans desirous of peace and reunification to pool their efforts and foil the moves of the war maniacs to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					They expressed the strong will of south Korean people to build a genuine democratic government, a government for welfare and a unified government without fail.
					
					More than 10 000 people including workers, students, mediapersons and teachers took to the streets on August 20 and 21. They shouted "Punish regime deteriorating people's livelihood!", "Withdraw layoff!", "Ensure political freedom of teachers and public officials!" and "Let us have registration fee halved and achieve just education!"
					
					Workers across south Korea issued the declaration on the situation and waged various other actions to punish the conservative ruling forces for pursuing unpopular rule, thus causing financial insolvency, skyrocketing prices, mass unemployment of youth and wholesale lay-offs.
					
					The struggle against the group of traitor's deceptive policy of halving the registration fee is being waged across south Korea with lots of people involved, dealing serious blows at the present regime.

articles.title: Resignation of Anti-reunification Conservative Elements Demanded
articles.content:
Resignation of Anti-reunification Conservative Elements Demanded

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The People's Action for the Resignation of Hyon In Thaek in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on August 30 demanding the replacement of all the anti-reunification conservative elements.
					
					A press release was read out at the press conference at the end of speeches.
					
					The press release referred to the fact that opposition parties presented a proposal calling for the dismissal of Hyon to the "National Assembly" on August 29.
					
					The authorities should bear in mind that this serves as the people's judgment of the present regime which denied the south-north joint declarations from the very day of their coming to power and drove the inter-Korean relations to a collapse by putting up the watchword of "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars," a policy of confrontation with compatriots, it said.
					
					It held that Hyon should step down as he played a leading role in shaping the present authorities' "policy towards the north" and all other conservative bureaucrats including Won Se Hun, director of the Intelligence Service, Kim Thae Hyo, chief secretary for foreign strategy of the secretariat of Chongwadae, and Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, be replaced with new ones.
					
					The press release warned the authorities would face stronger popular resistance, should they disregard the fellow countrymen's desire for reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Urged to Take Flexible Attitude to North
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Urged to Take Flexible Attitude to North

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- With public criticism of the policy toward the north growing in south Korea, the newly-appointed director of the Institute for Unification Studies Tuesday urged the "government" to take a flexible attitude towards the north, according to the south Korean MBC (Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation).
					
					Speaking to reporters, Kim Thae U said that any "government" of south Korea should not seek a "contingency" in the north.
					
					He stressed that the "government" should discard the wrong view that a "contingency" will lead to the country's unification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Outstanding Political Caliber and Leadership Art Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Outstanding Political Caliber and Leadership Art Praised

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- World public is highly praising leader Kim Jong Il for victoriously advancing the development of international relations and the human cause of independence with his outstanding political caliber and leadership art.
					
					Robert Charvin, honorary chairman of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, said that it would be unthinkable without the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK has proudly demonstrated its sovereignty and dignity in the international arena. 
					
					Baluchistan Times of Pakistan noted it is hard to find such great man as Kim Jong Il who has performed outstanding exploits for mankind and he is deeply revered by world public for his outstanding exploits for the human cause of independence.
					
					Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, said that Kim Jong Il has made an immortal contribution to the human cause of independence through his energetic external activities.
					
					The Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions in its statement noted that Kim Jong Il's visit to China was a landmark event of great significance in safeguarding peace and stability in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and confidently advancing socialism and the human cause of independence. 
					
					Petrov, secretary of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il visited Russia to further develop the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries and put the equal and multifaceted relations between the two countries on a new higher stage. These constitute the immortal exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the development of the Russia-DPRK relations, he added.
					
					He said that a lot of media in the world vied with each other in reporting about Kim Jong Il's tours of Russia and China, adding this is a clear proof of the high international prestige of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Daily Changing Appearance of DPRK Introduced by Various Newspapers
articles.content:
Daily Changing Appearance of DPRK Introduced by Various Newspapers

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries carried special write-ups and articles on the 51st anniversary of the start of Songun revolutionary leadership by Kim Jong Il.
					
					The Russian newspaper Veteran No. 30 noted that thanks to more than 50 years of Songun leadership provided by Kim Jong Il the Korean People's Army has grown stronger politically and ideologically and in military technique.
					
					The article said the DPRK has rapidly developed the overall economy of the country and improved the standard of people's living, while consistently adhering to the line of economic construction in the era of Songun.
					
					The Lao newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao on Aug. 23 and Ugandan newspaper Sun Rise on Aug. 25 carried photos of Kim Jong Il and edited articles praising his Songun leadership exploits.
					
					The Ecuadorian newspaper Tribuna on Aug. 21 carried the following article:
					
					The DPRK has firmly defended popular masses-centered socialism and pushed ahead with the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation while smashing the anti-DPRK moves of the imperialists under the banner of Songun.
					
					The Songun politics is, indeed, a political mode to be followed by the countries aspiring after independence as it is instrumental for repelling the moves of the imperialists, weathering all sorts of trials and difficulties and guaranteeing the victorious advance of the cause of revolution.

articles.title: Validity and Vitality of Songun Politics Appreciated by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Validity and Vitality of Songun Politics Appreciated by Peruvian Organization

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Cultural Center in Peru issued a bulletin on August 25 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership and the first anniversary of the center.
					
					The bulletin carried articles with his photo and other photos on cultural development in the DPRK.
					
					The validity and vitality of the Songun politics are being more fully displayed in the DPRK day by day, it said, and went on:
					
					The Korean People's Army has grown stronger to be revolutionary armed forces firmly prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique thanks to his Songun politics.
					
					All the people are learning from the revolutionary soldier culture created in the KPA, making revolutionary optimism, militant stamina and noble cultural emotion prevail throughout the society.
					
					The young people, in particular, are taking the lead in the drive to arm themselves with the Juche idea and the Songun idea and uphold the Songun politics.
					
					Kim Jong Il has energetically led the army and people of the DPRK in the drive for a great surge while providing field guidance to many industrial establishments and construction sites.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on August 24 and 25 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					A meeting was held in Bangladesh, lecture, photo exhibition and film show in Iran and lecture in Tanzania.
					
					On display at the photo exhibition hall were photos on his Songun leadership feats.
					
					Korean film "Reply of Korea" was shown on the occasion.
					
					Present at the events were personages of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the Bangladesh People's League, the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Dar-Es-Salaam Friendship Textile Mill and masses.
					
					The chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee and other speakers said that the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity and might as a political, ideological and military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					They expressed the conviction that the DPRK's cause of building a thriving nation and reunifying the country is sure to be achieved without fail as there are the army and people rallied close around their leader.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Mexican Political Figure as Beacon of Hope for World People
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Mexican Political Figure as Beacon of Hope for World People

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, on August 23 issued a statement on the 63rd anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					September 9 marks the 63rd anniversary of the DPRK, he said, stressing that the DPRK has become a beacon of hope and a banner of victory for the world people desirous of independence as it is emerging victorious and demonstrating its might thanks to the Songun politics,.
					
					The DPRK has developed to be a socialist state of Juche with invincible might and achieved great victories and brought about world-startling changes under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					All the members of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico are convinced that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would surely win victory in the general offensive to commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as a great jubilee in human history under the experienced and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said.

articles.title: UFG Condemned by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
UFG Condemned by Nigerian Organization

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 26 posted on its Internet homepage an article condemning the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their war maneuvers.
					
					The Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises vitiate the atmosphere of dialogue created by the unanimous desire of mankind desirous of peace and security on the Korean Peninsula as they are maneuvers of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers for a nuclear war against the DPRK, prompted by their invariable hostile aim to seize it by force of arms, the article said.
					
					The U.S. imperialists staged maneuvers for a war of aggression against the dialogue partner, while putting up the signboard of dialogue, it noted, and went on:
					
					This only increases the suspicion about the talk of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers about dialogue.
					
					Recalling that they let a "special action unit" whose mission is to detect and destroy the nukes of the DPRK participate in the joint military exercises, the article said: This is an indication that they are trying to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula by a brigandish method, not through dialogue and negotiations.

articles.title: Cooperation between China and Other Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation between China and Other Countries

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- China and Mongolia agreed to boost exchange and cooperation in the work of youth on Aug. 30.
					
					Earlier China and Serbia agreed to develop the cooperative relations in fields including politics, economy and infrastructure on Aug. 29.

articles.title: China Takes Measures to Prevent Damage from Draught
articles.content:
China Takes Measures to Prevent Damage from Draught

					Beijing, August 31 (KCNA) -- Heilongjiang Province, China, is positively conducting the work to introduce the water saving irrigation technology to prevent damage from the draught.
					
					This year 4 million-mu of farmland in the province has introduced this technology in order to increase grain production.

articles.title: China Plans to Protect Underground Water Resources
articles.content:
China Plans to Protect Underground Water Resources

					Beijing, August 31 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao recently presided over a State Council meeting. 
					
					Wen stressed at the meeting that protecting underground water resources is closely related to a sustained socio-economic development and to the existence and security of future generations.
					
					A 2011-2020 national plan for preventing contamination of underground water was discussed and adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Cadres Urged to Study Hard in China
articles.content:
Cadres Urged to Study Hard in China

					Beijing, August 31 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, head of the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, called on cadres to study hard.
					
					Speaking at a recent meeting, he said cadres should intensify study so that they can promote scientific development and social harmony.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Calls for Creating Many Operas
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Calls for Creating Many Operas

					Beijing, August 31 (KCNA) -- A senior Chinese official called for creating many fine operas with Chinese characteristics and national features.
					
					Li Changchun, a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, recently enjoyed the opera "Honghegu" (Red River Valley) and had a talk with its creative members.
					
					Li told them the opera is clear in theme, deep in content and high in ideological and artistic value.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Modernization of Coal Production
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Modernization of Coal Production

					Moscow, August 31 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin called for applying modern machines and latest technologies to coal production.
					
					In his congratulatory message sent to the officials and meritorious workers of the coal industrial sector on Aug. 28, the Day of Coal Miners, the prime minister underlined the need to pay close attention to the labor safety of coal miners.

articles.title: State Duma Election Day Fixed in Russia
articles.content:
State Duma Election Day Fixed in Russia

					Moscow, August 31 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev decided to have a State Duma election in the country on December 4. 
					
					He met with the leaders of seven political parties on Aug. 29 and informed them of the decision.

articles.title: Vietnam's National Day Marked
articles.content:
Vietnam's National Day Marked

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Thursday on the 66th anniversary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					
					Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					Staff members of the embassy were present there.
					
					Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Black Sea Nations Stage Naval Exercise
articles.content:
Black Sea Nations Stage Naval Exercise

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The black sea nations finished an exercise of naval vessels' joint operation in Bulgaria on Monday.
					
					Russia, Bulgaria, Romania, Turkey and Ukraine participated in the exercise.
					
					The allied naval forces reportedly attained the goal of the exercise.

articles.title: Revolution and Socialism Are Only Way for Mankind
articles.content:
Revolution and Socialism Are Only Way for Mankind

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Daniel Ortega Saavedra, president of Nicaragua, said at the Lain America Trade Union Meeting on Aug. 27 that the only way to save the mankind is the revolution and socialism.
					
					Noting that capitalism is going to wreck and ruin due to its unreasonableness, he said that any economic, technological and military "might" could not save capitalism from crisis.
					
					He said that the progressive forces in Latin America are growing stronger, demonstrating their might and the people do not stop the struggle even a moment.

articles.title: Unjust Assertion of West Attacked by Iranian Foreign Ministry
articles.content:
Unjust Assertion of West Attacked by Iranian Foreign Ministry

					Tehran, August 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the foreign ministry of Iran resolutely rejected the unjust assertion of the West against his country on Aug. 29.
					
					Recently the West claimed that the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran meddled in the internal affairs of Syria. The claim is groundless and aimed to shift the responsibilities on to other country, the spokesman said.
					
					Noting that the Syrian government and people have ample ability to settle the problems of their country for themselves, the spokesman said that Iran respects the sovereignty of all the countries.

articles.title: Iran to Continue Enriching Uranium
articles.content:
Iran to Continue Enriching Uranium

					Tehran, August 31 (KCNA) -- The president of the Atomic Energy Organisation of Iran expressed the stand of Iran to continue enriching the 20 per cent uranium at an interview with an agency on Aug. 29.
					
					The president said that Iran would continue enriching the 20 per cent uranium and increase the amount of nuclear fuel for the reactor for research.
					
					But Iran does not plan to enrich more than 20 percent uranium, the president said.

articles.title: Pakistani Lawmaker Backs Iran's Right to Nuclear Technology
articles.content:
Pakistani Lawmaker Backs Iran's Right to Nuclear Technology

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Talking to IRNA, Senator Tariq Azeem of Pakistan Muslim League-Q said that it is legitimate right of Iran to develop nuclear technology for peaceful means on Aug. 29. 
					
					"Nobody can dictate Iran over its nuclear program," he made it clear.
					
					"Sanctions are counter productive and have made Iran stronger," he said.

articles.title: Iran Mass-produces Anti-Armor Rockets
articles.content:
Iran Mass-produces Anti-Armor Rockets

					Tehran, August 31 (KCNA) -- Iran started mass production of the anti-armor rockets for destroying tanks, armored cars and ammunition chamber of the enemy.
					
					The Iranian minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics made the remarks on Aug. 29, adding that it is another proof of the great capabilities of the Iranian defence industry to cope with threat of the enemies.
					
					The 73 millimeter caliber rocket is said to be equipped with the warhead which can destroy targets at the distance of 1 300 meters.

articles.title: Decision of Nuclear Waste Transport by West Censured
articles.content:
Decision of Nuclear Waste Transport by West Censured

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Caribbean Community in a statement on Aug. 27 accused the West of a decision on the nuclear waste transport.
					
					Some Western countries decided to transport high radioactive nuclear waste from Asia to Europe through the Caribbean sea. In this regard the statement noted that it may endanger the life of the people and the stability of the region.
					
					The community can never accept such decision of the West, the statement said.

articles.title: Drugs Seized in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Drugs Seized in Bulgaria

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian police exposed the moves to smuggle the drugs with trucks at the border post of the Danube and seized 15 kilograms of heroin. 
					
					From January to November last year 305 kilos of heroin was confiscated in this country.

articles.title: Uruguayan Gov't Worried by Treatment to Migrants in US
articles.content:
Uruguayan Gov't Worried by Treatment to Migrants in US

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan authorities have expressed their concern by the maltreatment received by Uruguayan migrants in the USA.
					
					A total of 82 Uruguayans have been expelled from the USA in the past months, some of them treated as criminals, assured Uruguayan Foreign Minister Luis Almagro, in an interview to newspaper La Republica, published Sunday.

articles.title: Another NATO Soldier Killed in Afghanistan's Restive South
articles.content:
Another NATO Soldier Killed in Afghanistan's Restive South

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A NATO soldier was killed in an operation in Afghanistan's restive southern region on Sunday, bringing the number of military alliance casualties to three in a single day Sunday, NATO said on Monday.
					
					Over 410 NATO soldiers, most of them Americans, have been killed in Afghanistan since the beginning of this year.

articles.title: New PM Elected in Japan
articles.content:
New PM Elected in Japan

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Yoshihiko Noda who was chosen as new representative of the Democratic Party of Japan was elected prime minister.
					
					He was elected to the premiership at the full-dress session of both houses of the Diet on August 30.
					
					Meanwhile, the Naoto Kan Cabinet resigned en bloc that day.

articles.title: Serious Nuclear Contamination in Japan
articles.content:
Serious Nuclear Contamination in Japan

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Nuclear contamination is getting serious in Japan, making trouble.
					
					Incinerator dust and ash with too much radioactive cesium to allow it to be buried has been found at 42 facilities in Tokyo, Chiba, Iwate and three other prefectures as well as Fukushima, the Environment Ministry said Saturday.
					
					Meanwhile, a small amount of radioactive cesium was detected in raw rice in Nihonmatsu, some 60 kilometers from the crippled Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant.

articles.title: Economic Depression in U.S., Australia
articles.content:
Economic Depression in U.S., Australia

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The National Association of Realtors (NAR) said that its index of pending home sales shed 1.3 percent from 90.9 in June to 89.7 in July. This is attributable to the drop of inhabitants' purchasing power due to economic depression.
					
					Meanwhile, the number of new homes sold in July dropped by eight percent.

articles.title: Crimes Rampant in Germany
articles.content:
Crimes Rampant in Germany

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Crimes are rampant in Germany, sparking off big social furor.
					
					5.93 million crimes were officially registered in the country in 2010, the police authorities recently quoted investigation data as saying.

articles.title: Uganda Hit by Landslides
articles.content:
Uganda Hit by Landslides

					Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Landslides caused by heavy rain hit the eastern mountainous area of Uganda on August 29, causing damage.
					
					The landslides left 22 persons dead and more than 30 missing.
					
					Relief work is under way on the spot.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun envia mensaje a su homologo cubano
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun envia mensaje a su homologo cubano

					Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun envio el 29 de agosto a su homologo cubano Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla en ocasion del 51o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica de Cuba.
					
					El remitente expresa su irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de agencia Kyodo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de agencia Kyodo

					Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia primero en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la Agencia de Noticias Kyodo de Japon y sus agencias afiliadas encabezada por el presidente Satoshi Ishigawa.

articles.title: Funcionarios de embajadas visitan palacio de escolares de Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Funcionarios de embajadas visitan palacio de escolares de Mangyongdae

					Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 63o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los funcionarios encargados de los asuntos culturales y de amistad de las embajadas de varios paises en Corea visitaron el dia primero el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae.
					
					Los huespedes recorrieron las salas de varios circulos escuchando explicaciones sobre el hecho de que gracias al gran amor del Presidente Kim Il Sung y dell Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el citado palacio se ha acondicionado como magnifico centro de educacion extraescolar para las nuevas generaciones.
					
					Acto seguido, disfrutaron la funcion ofrecida por los miembros del circulo artistico del palacio.

articles.title: Grupo de turismo piloto concluye su visita al monte Kumgang
articles.content:
Grupo de turismo piloto concluye su visita al monte Kumgang

					Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El grupo de turismo internacional piloto Rason-monte Kumgang encabezado por Kim Song Mun, director de la Administracion de Viajes y Turismo de la region autonoma de coreanos de Yanbian de China recorrio el dia 31 de agosto y el primero de septiembre el famoso monte Kumgang de Corea.
					
					Los turistas se quedaron maravillados del paraje raro y hermoso de la cascada Kuryong, el lago Samil y el Kumgang maritimo.
					
					Presenciaron tambien la funcion del Conjunto Circense Moranbong de Pyongyang.
					
					Durante la estancia del grupo, tuvo lugar el encuentro de explicacion sobre las inversiones en la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang.
					
					El grupo regreso el dia primero a bordo del barco Mangyongbong.

articles.title: Revela peligrosidad de modificacion de constitucion de Japon
articles.content:
Revela peligrosidad de modificacion de constitucion de Japon

					Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, un politico conservador de alto rango de Japon, en una zona de acantonamiento de las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa" en Hokkaido, dijo que todavia no se ha creado el ambiente que permita a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" actuar en el marco que define dignamente la Constitucion y agrego que el partido en el poder y los de oposicion deben crear de inmediato tal ambiente colaborandose mutuamente.
					
					Esto demuestra que se tornan mas abiertas en una nueva fase las maquinaciones de Japon encaminadas a convertir las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en el "ejercito legal" a traves de la modificacion de la Constitucion actual y usarlas como aparato militar por la realizacion de ambicion de agresion al extranjero.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					La Constitucion vigente de Japon profesada hasta la fecha como "simbolo del Estado pacifico" prohibe la posesion de las fuerzas armadas regulares y la combatividad y su participacion en la guerra. 
					
					Los militaristas japoneses, que persiguen la potencia militar y la ambicion de nueva agresion, la consideran como una cosa molesta, de manera que intentan modificar la "constitucion de paz" por la belica.
					
					Su objetivo es convertir las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en las fuerzas regulares, legalizar y politizar el establecimiento del sistema de movilizacion en el tiempo de guerra y el cumplimiento de la guerra. O sea, los reaccionarios japoneses tratan de establecer la Constitucion de guerra, abrir legalmente la puerta de nueva agresion y realizar la ambicion militarista. He aqui la criminalidad y la peligrosidad de las maquinaciones de enmienda constitucional de los militares japoneses.
					
					Japon trata de modernizar mas las fuerzas armadas militaristas, completar los preparativos de agresion al ultramar y ponerlos en accion en cualquier momento. Su primer blanco de operacion es la RPDC.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses hablan sin titubeo del despacho de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" en el "tiempo de emergencia" en la Peninsula Coreana e intentan abiertamente usurpar el islote Tok, lo cual prueba elocuentemente que se acerca la nueva agresion a Corea.
